Label: Cyp3A4
Comment: Reaction also occurs in mouse: CYP3A11

Label: IL-17A
Comment: IL-17 familiy is essential in host defense and may play key pathogenic roles in autoimmune diseases. [PMID: 25092323]

Label: BACS (SLC27A5)
Comment: Bile Acid CoA ligase (or synthetase)</br>microsomal protein mostly expressed in liver [PMID:24309898, 25409824(mouse)]

Label: CYP3A4
Comment: CYP3A11 in mouse is responsible for this conversion! [pmid:31698146;11454857]

Label: AKR1D1
Comment: Reduction and oxidation  (presumably by AKR1D1 and AKR1C4) may precede before or after 24-hydroxylation.

Label: DHCR7
Comment: ChEH is a dimer of 7-dehydrocholesterol reductase (DHCR7) and 3β-hydroxysteroid-Δ8-Δ7-isomerase (D8D7I)</br> the 3beta-hydroxysteroid delta7 reductase (DHCR7), which is the regulatory subunit. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cholesterol-5,6-oxide_hydrolase]

Label: D8D7I
Comment: ChEH is a dimer of 7-dehydrocholesterol reductase (DHCR7) and 3β-hydroxysteroid-Δ8-Δ7-isomerase (D8D7I)</br>also known as the emopamyl binding protein (EBP), which is the catalytic subunit [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cholesterol-5,6-oxide_hydrolase]

Label: CYP3A4
Comment: Alternative protein to CH25H for hydroxylation

Label: 24S-HC
Comment: AKA (24S)-hydroxycholesterol</br>Can corss the Blood-Brain-Barrier (to remove cholesterol from brain tissue) [PMID:8790411; 9717719]

Label: LBP
Comment: L-bifunctional protein, aka MFP1, enoyl-CoA hydratase and 3-hydroxacyl CoA dehydrogenase EHHADH).

Label: ROR-γt
Comment: AKA RAR-related orphan receptor gamma (RORγt); consists of 2 isoforms: RORγ and RORγt. This nuclear receptor is required for generating IL-17-producing CD4(+) Th17 T cells.</br>RORγt (also known as RORγ2) – produced from an mRNA identical to that of RORγ, except that the two 5'-most exons are replaced by an alternative exon, located downstream in the gene. This causes a different, shorter N-terminus. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RAR-related_orphan_receptor_gamma]

Label: ACOT
Comment: acyl-CoA thioesterase are a group of enzymes

Label: VLCS (SLC27A2)
Comment: very-long chain acyl-CoA synthetase</br>expressed mostly in liver and kidney, and present in ER and peroxisome [PMID:24309898, 25409824(mouse)]

Label: Cholestane-3-beta,5-alpha, 6-beta-triol
Comment: AKA cholestane-3β,5α,6β-triol</br>Biomarker for NPC1; elevated levels of cholestane-3β,5α,6β-triol in plasma from NPC1 patients. [PMID: 21048217].

Label: 7-alpha,25-diHC
Comment: AKA 7α,25-Dihydroxycholesterol</br>Involved in immune response (agonist of G-protein-coupled receptor EBI2 (AKA GPR183)) [PMID: 21796212, 21796211].

Label: (25R)26-HC
Comment: AKA (25R)26-hydroxycholesterol; Named with systematic nomenclature, where hydroxylation at the terminal side chain of cholesterol is on C-26 leading to 26-hydroxycholesterol (26-HC) which may have 25R or 25S stereochemistry [26]. Unless stated otherwise 25R stereochemistry is assumed. In much of the literature (25R)26-HC is referred to 27-hydroxycholesterol (27-HC), presumably the 25R isomer. [PMID:22366074]</br>26-HC, 25R-stereochemistry is assumed unless indicated otherwise, also called 27-hydroxycholesterol [PMID:31698146]

Label: Cyp7A1
Comment: cholesterol 7 alpha-hydroxylase, the rate-limiting enzyme in bile acid biosynthesis.</br>the transcript of which is almost exclusively expressed in liver [PMID:31698146]

Label: Cyp46A1
Comment: Responsible for cholesterol homeostasis in brain [PMID:8790411]. Expressed mainly in Brain, however also small quantities in testis and ovary [PMID:24309898,25409824(mouse)].

Label: ChEH
Comment: AKA cholesterol epoxide hydrolase (ChEH); EC: 3.3.2.11</br>ChEH is a dimer of 7-dehydrocholesterol reductase (DHCR7) and 3β-hydroxysteroid-Δ8-Δ7-isomerase (D8D7I)

Label: IL-17B
Comment: IL-17 familiy is essential in host defense and may play key pathogenic roles in autoimmune diseases. [PMID: 25092323]

Label: IL-17C
Comment: IL-17 familiy is essential in host defense and may play key pathogenic roles in autoimmune diseases. [PMID: 25092323]

Label: IL-17D
Comment: IL-17 familiy is essential in host defense and may play key pathogenic roles in autoimmune diseases. [PMID: 25092323]

Label: IL-17E
Comment: IL-17 familiy is essential in host defense and may play key pathogenic roles in autoimmune diseases. [PMID: 25092323]

Label: IL-17F
Comment: IL-17 familiy is essential in host defense and may play key pathogenic roles in autoimmune diseases. [PMID: 25092323]

Label: 7α−HCO
Comment: aka 7α-hydroxycholest-4-en-3-one</br>7α−HCO is a ligand to the pregnane X receptor (PXR), a member of the nuclear receptor superfamily [PMID:31698146]

Label: 3β-HCA
Comment: AKA (25R)-3beta-hydroxycholest-5-en-26-oic acid; 3β-HC-5-en-(25R)26-oic acid</br>Pathway starting from this metabolite to 3β,7alpha-HCA is considered the acidic or alternative PW of bile acid biosynthesis [PMID:31698146,12543708]

Label: 7a,25-DiH-3-oxocholest-4-en-26-oic acid
Comment: aka 7a,25-Dihydroxy-3-oxocholest-4-en-26-oic acid; 7alpha,25-diH,3O-CA</br>Found in human plasma and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) [PMID:29960034]; reduced levels found in Alzheimers disease.

Label: CYP39A1
Comment: Mostly expressed in liver, also in brain [PMID:24309898,25409824 (mouse)]

Label: 7a,24S-diH,3O-CA
Comment: aka 7a,24S-Dihydroxy-3-oxocholest-4-en-26-oic acid, 7a,24S-DiH-3-oxocholest-4-en-26-oic acid</br>Identified in human plasma [PMID:29960034] and CSF [PMID:30578919,29960034]

Label: AKR1C4
Comment: Reduction and oxidation  (presumably by AKR1D1 and AKR1C4) may precede before or after 24-hydroxylation.

Label: 24S-HC
Comment: AKA (24S)-hydroxycholesterol</br>Can corss the Blood-Brain-Barrier (to remove cholesterol from brain tissue) [PMID:8790411; 9717719]

Label: ACOT2
Comment: originally thought to be in peroxisome [PMID:10944470)], later found to be mitochondrial [PMID:16940157] [https://www.uniprot.org/uniprot/P49753]

Label: ACOT4
Comment: Compared to mouse peroxisomal succinyl-coenzyme A thioesterase/ACOT4, the human enzyme has a broad substrate specificity overlapping the activity of three mouse acyl-coenzyme A thioesterases, providing an explanation for the unexpectedly low number of acyl-coenzyme A thioesterase genes in the human genome [PMID:16940157] [https://www.uniprot.org/uniprot/Q8N9L9]

Label: ACOT7L
Comment: Could be the product of a pseudogene. The peptide used to produce antibodies against ACOT7L matches at 85% with ACOT7 and the antibodies may not be specific to ACOT7L. [https://www.uniprot.org/uniprot/Q6ZUV0]

Label: BACS (SLC27A5)
Comment: Bile Acid CoA ligase (or synthetase)</br>microsomal protein mostly expressed in liver [PMID:24309898, 25409824(mouse)]

Label: VLCS (SLC27A2)
Comment: very-long chain acyl-CoA synthetase</br>expressed mostly in liver and kidney, and present in ER and peroxisome [PMID:24309898, 25409824(mouse)]
